intro: Chrysochlamys standleyana, commonly known as the golden chrysochlamys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species for horticultural and ecological studies.
